meanings.definition: A musical instrument consisting of a single string stretched over a sound box.
meanings.sent1: The musician plucked the monochords gently, producing a soft melody.
meanings.sent2: She admired the craftsmanship of the monochords displayed in the museum.
meanings.sent3: The monochords whispered a sweet tune to the audience, making them smile.
meanings.sent4: His heart resonated like the vibrations of monochords, feeling the music deeply.
meanings.sent5: The monochords hummed with a magical charm, enchanting all who listened.

meanings.definition: A device used for tuning musical instruments by measuring intervals.
meanings.sent1: The musician adjusted the tension of the monochords to tune the guitar perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The monochords helped him ensure each note was in harmony during the performance.
meanings.sent3: Using the monochords, he tuned the piano with precision, earning applause.
meanings.sent4: The monochords acted as a musical compass, guiding him to the right pitch.
meanings.sent5: With the monochords in hand, he fine-tuned the violin to perfection.
